com.nokia.mid.ui
Interface TextEditorListener

public interface TextEditorListener

A listener for receiving notification of content changes and other editor events from TextEditor objects. The events are generated on content changes that are either a result of a programmatical change or due to an user input.

Since:
1.4

Field Summary
static int ACTION_CARET_MOVE
          Indicates that the caret in this TextEditor has moved.
static int ACTION_CONTENT_CHANGE
          Indicates that the content of this TextEditor has changed.
static int ACTION_DIRECTION_CHANGE
          Indicates that the direction of the writing-language has changed.
static int ACTION_INPUT_MODE_CHANGE
          Indicates that the current input-mode has changed.
static int ACTION_LANGUAGE_CHANGE
          Indicates that the current input-language has changed.
static int ACTION_OPTIONS_CHANGE
          Indicates that the options of this TextEditor have changed.
static int ACTION_PAINT_REQUEST
          Indicates that this TextEditor has to be repainted.
static int ACTION_SCROLLBAR_CHANGED
          Indicates that scrollbar should be updated.
static int ACTION_TRAVERSE_NEXT
          Indicates that the user tries to exit this TextEditor downwards.
static int ACTION_TRAVERSE_OUT_SCROLL_DOWN
          Indicates that the editor cannot scroll down anymore.
static int ACTION_TRAVERSE_OUT_SCROLL_UP
          Indicates that the editor cannot scroll up anymore.
static int ACTION_TRAVERSE_PREVIOUS
          Indicates that the user tries to exit this TextEditor upwards.
 
Method Summary
 void inputAction(TextEditor textEditor, int actions)
          This method is called by the platform to notify the client about events in a TextEditor.

Constant Field Values

ACTION_PAINT_REQUEST

static final int ACTION_PAINT_REQUEST
Indicates that this TextEditor has to be repainted. The application should service this request by refreshing at least the region covered by the TextEditor in its Canvas, which will also cause the TextEditor itself to be redrawn. This can be accomplished by the MIDlet calling either Canvas#repaint(x,y,width,height) or GameCanvas#flushGraphics(x,y,width,height).

See Also:

Method Detail

inputAction

void inputAction(TextEditor textEditor,
                 int actions)
This method is called by the platform to notify the client about events in a TextEditor. A call to this method may represent more than one event. The events are masked into the actions-parameter, so an application can determine which events have occured via
if( (actions&TextEditorListener.ACTION_CONTENT_CHANGE)!=0){
...
}
if( (actions&TextEditorListener.ACTION_CARET_CHANGE)!=0){
...
}

Parameters:
textEditor - the TextEditor instance where the event occured
actions - the events that occured.
